intro: Monopyle puberula, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves that give it a velvety texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish or brownish in color. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Monopyle puberula is often found in disturbed habitats and can become invasive in certain regions.
